metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15665 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Firefox did not reset the address bar after the beforeunload dialog was shown if the user chose to remain on the page. This could have resulted in an incorrect URL being shown when used in conjunction with other unexpected browser behaviors. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
